Title: Do more experienced developers introduce fewer bugs?
Published: IFIP International Conference on Open Source Systems
Elements_risk_assessment:
modified or removed lines in a fixing commit are the ones suspicious of
    having caused the fixing action (or being part of the error)
UseOF-SZZ: The identification of commits inducing fixing actions is based on the SZZ algorithm
Summary:
to study the relationships between experience and the bug introduction ratio using the 
    Mozilla community as case of study
Outcome:
there is no correlation between any of the ways we measure experience and the bug seeding 
    ratio
